wikipedia_page.main:
John Andrew Long (1869–1941) was a unionist politician in Northern Ireland.
Long worked as a farmer and served on various public boards before his election as an Ulster Unionist member of the Senate of Northern Ireland in 1921, serving until his death in 1941. He was Deputy Leader of the Senate and Parliamentary Secretary in the Department of the Prime Minister from 1930 to 1941.

response: * Senator John Andrew Long - Former Chairman of Limavady Rural Council and Northern Ireland Senator 1921-d1941 (elected) Deputy Speaker 1927–28; Deputy Leader 1930–41, Parliamentary Secretary in the Department of the Prime Minister from 1930 to 1941.
*John Andrew Long (1869–1941), Senator in Northern Ireland
*John Andrew Long (1869–1941), Northern Irish Senator from 1921 to 1941
